elephant.name: Elephant
elephant.habitat: Grasslands, forests, and savannas across Asia and Africa
elephant.funFact: Elephants use their trunks for breathing, smelling, touching, and more.
elephant.description: Elephants are gentle giants known for their intelligence, memory, and strong family bonds.

tiger.name: Bengal Tiger
tiger.funFact: Tigers are excellent swimmers and each has unique stripes.
tiger.description: The Bengal Tiger is the most numerous tiger subspecies. It is found primarily in India, with smaller populations in Bangladesh, Nepal, Bhutan, China, and Myanmar.

lion.name: Lion
lion.habitat: Savannas, grasslands, and open woodlands of sub-Saharan Africa
lion.funFact: Lions are the only big cats that live in social groups called prides.
lion.description: African lions are powerful predators known for their majestic manes and social behavior. Males defend the prideâ€™s territory, while females do most of the hunting.
